# Noah Debrincat - Lead Product Manager

> YC Alum. Former Founder. Building AI-powered healthcare solutions at Curebase.

## Summary

Noah Debrincat is a Lead Product Manager at Curebase, specializing in AI/ML healthcare applications and clinical trial software. He has 5+ years of product experience, founded a medical device startup (Zergo) through Y Combinator, and holds a B.A.Sc. in Nanotechnology Engineering from the University of Waterloo.

## Current Role

Lead Product Manager at Curebase (July 2024 – Present), building clinical trial software used by pharmaceutical companies including Gilead Life Sciences, Walgreens, and Genentech.

## Key Accomplishments

- Built LLM-powered no-code validator that saves 400+ engineering hours annually and enabled 100% Customer Success autonomy
- Shipped contact center platform 3x faster than industry standard (6 weeks vs. 18-week baseline) with 18 features for 150+ users
- Architected custom email automation platform replacing a $150K Customer.io contract, enabling $200K annual Walgreens BARDA revenue
- Partnered with Gilead on Hope4All breast cancer registry achieving 3+ years sustained organic growth with zero marketing spend
- Created $350K+ annual value across shipped features

## Expertise

- Product Strategy & Execution (0→1 and growth)
- AI/ML Applications & LLM Integration
- Healthcare Technology & Clinical Trials
- Technical Product Management (APIs, data pipelines)
- Cross-functional Leadership & Stakeholder Management
- User Research (100+ hours of interviews)

## Career Timeline

- Lead Product Manager, Curebase (July 2024 – Present)
- Product Manager, Curebase (Oct 2023 – July 2024)
- Chief of Staff, Curebase (July 2020 – Oct 2023)
- Founder, Y Combinator (May 2019 – Oct 2019)
- CEO & Head of Product, Zergo / SannTek Labs (June 2018 – July 2020)
- B.A.Sc. Nanotechnology Engineering, University of Waterloo (May 2018)

## Philosophy

"Move fast, measure everything, never lose sight of the user."
